intro: Galium affrenum, commonly known as the African bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture. Galium affrenum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
